Watertown cyclist killed during charity trek in Maine

David LeClair, 23, was struck and killed by a tractor-trailer truck while bicycling in a 180-mile charity ride to benefit the American Lung Association. (1:30 p.m.)
  • Remembering fallen cyclists | 6/4 Jamaica Plain cyclist struck and killed by truck in California

Conn. chimp victim denied $150m lawsuit

The family of Charla Nash, who was disfigured in a 2009 chimpanzee attack, has been denied permission to sue Connecticut. (3:22 p.m.)
  • 11/29/12 $4m settlement in Connecticut chimp attack
  • 6/10/11 Chimp victim gets face transplant at Brigham

1 arrested in bleach attack on MBTA bus

Two more females are being sought in connection to a bleach attack and robbery in Dorchester, Transit Police said. (3:44 p.m.)

Yes, Texas, there is a Christmas

Texas Governor Rick Perry's signing of the so-called "Merry Christmas" bill, which had bipartisan support from state lawmakers, removes legal risks from using the popular holiday greeting in the state's schools.

Cubby Tees has pulled the shirts and released a statement calling Boston fans reactionary and lacking "an open mind, earnest desire for discourse or an ability to comprehend complex concepts like parody."

State cop fatally shoots N. Bedford driver

A trooper fired his gun in a “violent confrontation” with Wilfredo Justiniano Jr. on Route 28 in Quincy near the Randolph line, officials said. (3:15 p.m.)
  • Watch State Police discuss trooper shooting in Quincy

Sentencing delayed for ex-Chelsea Housing Authority boss McLaughlin

A judge postponed sentencing for Michael E. McLaughlin after prosecutors said he may have obstructed justice by instructing an ex-staffer to destroy time cards. (3:29 p.m.)

Report: Commander of Nazi-led unit in Ukraine is living in US

A Nazi commander accused of burning villages filled with women and children lied to US immigration and has been living in Minnesota since shortly after WWII, according to the AP.
